description: DOM debugging allows setting breakpoints on particular DOM operations and events. JavaScript execution will stop on these operations as if there was a regular breakpoint set.

commands.name: setDOMBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular operation with DOM.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the operation to stop upon.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: removeDOMBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes DOM breakpoint that was set using setDOMBreakpoint.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to remove breakpoint from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the breakpoint to remove.

commands.name: setEventBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular event of given type.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: The name of the specific event to stop on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: removeEventBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes breakpoint on particular event of given type.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: The name of the specific event to stop on.

commands.name: setURLBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on network activity for the given URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring or regular expression. All requests having this substring in the URL will get stopped upon. An empty string will pause on all requests.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: Whether the URL string is a regular expression.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to apply to this breakpoint to modify its behavior.

commands.name: removeURLBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes breakpoint from network activity for the given URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring. An empty string will stop pausing on all requests.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: Whether the URL string is a regular expression.
